title: PM Modi promises fuel price review if BJP wins in Rajasthan | Latest News India - Hindustan Times
selftext:
>Addressing a public rally in Pali, Modi said,
>#####“In the neighbouring states of Rajasthan, there is a BJP government. There, petrol is ₹97 per litre. But the Congress government in Rajasthan sells petrol at higher prices.”

>*“I give a guarantee that after the BJP government is formed, the prices of petrol and diesel will be reviewed... This will give relief to the poor and middle-class people,”* he added.

>Modi also targeted the Congress government over the rising cases of crimes against women in Rajasthan, claiming that the grand old party has made the state number one in such incidents.

>*"Congress has made Rajasthan number one in crimes against women. The CM says that the complaints filed by the women are fake. Can it ever happen that a woman in our country files a fake case? The CM should say that a probe is underway, and not that the cases filed are fake. Isn't this an insult to women?"* he said.
comments: Nothing to see here folks nd this is not Revdi 🤷‍♂️

> “Wherever there is the double-engine government of BJP, every scheme of the central government is implemented on the ground faster, or the state governments of the BJP add something to it,” Modi said.   

How has Manipur's double engine govt worked for us?
Not reduced anymore, only reviewed. Haha!
Cool. What’s the price of petrol in Madhya Pradesh?
After review, we have decided to add 20 rupees of cess to petrol and diesel in Rajasthan. Time to contribute towards nation building.

every scheme of the central government is implemented on the ground faster.

Rioting is a scheme of the government.

Meanwhile, Rahul Gandhi promised 10,000 rupees deposit every year for every woman in Rajasthan.


These people are straight up buying votes at this point

>review

It can result in higher fuel prices as a result. Beware.
god. it's around 98 here in gurgaon and it amuses me every time i get a refill that how this has been normalized.
Exactly. He should start with MP and Shivraj Singh Chouhan before Rajasthan.
